tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE PilatesInstructors (
  instructor_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  instructor_name VARCHAR(50),
  instructor_email VARCHAR(100) UNIQUE,
  instructor_phone VARCHAR(20),
  schedule_hours FLOAT,
  hourly_rate DECIMAL(10, 2)
)

CREATE TABLE schedule (
    schedule_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    instructor_id INT,
    date DATE,
    start_time TIME,
    end_time TIME
);

CREATE TABLE ClassSchedules (
    schedule_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    class_date DATE,
    class_time TIME,
    instructor_id INT,
    FOREIGN KEY (instructor_id) REFERENCES Employees(employee_id)
);

CREATE TABLE Payroll (
    payroll_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    employee_id INT,
    salary DECIMAL(8,2),
    payment_date DATE,
    FOREIGN KEY (employee_id) REFERENCES Employees(employee_id)
);

CREATE TABLE Attendance (
    attendance_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    schedule_id INT,
    employee_id INT,
    attendance_status VARCHAR(20),
    FOREIGN KEY (schedule_id) REFERENCES ClassSchedules(schedule_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (employee_id) REFERENCES Employees(employee_id)
);

CREATE TABLE Instructors (
  instructor_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  name VARCHAR(50),
  email VARCHAR(50) UNIQUE,
  phone_number VARCHAR(20),
  hire_date DATE
);
